instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01598 firmware issue
threads.message:
Arrived boot looping with chime every few seconds but nothing more. Customer claims it just randomly started happening, no recent updates.

When in Apple controller 2 DFU mode I get a error "The system cannot be restored on this device" Device added from invalid state Restoring 0XFAA(4010)"

What should be tried next?

threads.title: 820-01598 firmware issue
threads.message: SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages cycling, or stable?

threads.title: 820-01598 firmware issue
threads.message: SLPS2R 1.1V AWAKE  0.385V  Both are stable only a/c adapter connected

threads.title: 820-01598 firmware issue
threads.message: There are several AWAKE and SLPS2R power rails...

threads.title: 820-01598 firmware issue
threads.message:
PP1V2_AWAKE 1.198V
PP1V8_AWAKE 1.8V
PP3V3_AWAKE 3.3V

PP0V8_SLPS2R 1.7V
PP1V8_SLS2R 1.8V
PP1V1_SLS2R 1.1V

threads.title: 820-01598 firmware issue
threads.message:
1.7V at 0V8 power rail?
Check again, that's no good.
